title: Being a musician, how are you surviving the Covid-19 time? - Quora

response.answer_text: I am glad that I don’t depend on music for an income, as there are NO GIGS or CONCERTS!!! This is a lonely time as we are not able to rehearse even. I suppose we could “ lay down tracks “ in a studio, but are improvisers and inventors as a matter of definition. …. music is a social activity. So I have been composing, mostly small things. Trying out new notation forms. Transcribing other works to learn and keep my ear fresh. besides playing the piano daily, I have been exploring watercolor. I miss playing so much. Never quite sure when it will be safe again.

I am a freelance musician, so my income is never fixed and secured. Everyday I have to struggle for my basic needs. I used to teach both offline and online, because of the pandemic I am now available only on online. A few of my offline students, taking online classes and a few of them have gone ! Out of thirteen online students, only TWO of them, who are supporting me financially, by giving double fees, plus extra money, to help my entire family. I am really greatful to them. May God bless them.🙏 Thank you for reading ❤️

I get occasional requests for piping at funerals. I ONLY play graveside services. No indoor. Social distancing, no handshakes, and no hugging. I’ve also been making little videos of either piping, playing guitar and singing, reading poetry, and that sort of things, and posting them to Facebook, just to keep people entertained. Not trying to make any money at it.

Because I made a very good, very smart decision decades ago to do music as a hobby and not a job. A very serious hobby, but my medical day gig has been the best decision I ever made. I do miss playing music live during this pandemic, but i don’t have to worry about keeping the lights on, and I very much sympathize with those pro musicians who do.
